Package app.service

Class Manager

java.lang.Object
app.service.Manager
public class Manager extends Object
Store all functionality that a manager can do, and would ever want to do from their screen

      Get all menu items
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Item,String Pairs, where Item is the item object, and String is the description of the item

      Add a new item to the menu
      Parameters:

      Parameters:

    • updateMenuItem

      public static void updateMenuItem(Item item)
      Update item's price in the database to the item's currently stored price
      Parameters:
      item - newly updated item object to be reflected in the database

    • getAllInventory

      public static ArrayList<Ingredient> getAllInventory()
      Get entire list of ingredients in inventory
      Returns:
      list of inventory ingredients

    • restockAll

      public static void restockAll(int amount)
      Restock all items in inventory, adding amount to all quantities
      Parameters:
      amount - amount to be added to each quantity

    • restockIngredient

      public static void restockIngredient(int amount, String ingredientName)
      Restock particular ingredient given by name, by a particular amount
      Parameters:
      amount - amount to add to ingredient's quantity
      ingredientName - name of ingredient to be restocked

    • changeIngredientThreshold

      public static void changeIngredientThreshold(int threshold, String name)
      Set ingredient's minimum threshold
      Parameters:
      threshold - new value of lower bound
      name - name of ingredient to change

    • getSalesReport

      public static HashMap<String,Integer> getSalesReport(Timestamp start, Timestamp end)
      Get sales report for the timeframe between start and end Sales report is the amount of each item sold over a given window in time
      Parameters:
      start - start date of consideration window
      end - end date of consideration window
      Returns:
      mapping between item name and quantity sold over the time period

    • getExcessReport

      public static HashSet<String> getExcessReport(Timestamp start, Timestamp end)
      Get excess report for timeframe between start and end Excess report gives the items that sold less than 10% of their current inventory over a given time window
      Parameters:
      start - start date of consideration window
      end - end date of consideration window
      Returns:
      set of ingredient names having excess inventory

    • getRestockReport

      public static ArrayList<String> getRestockReport()
      Get restock report, which is all ingredients below their minimum threshold, thus requiring restocking
      Returns:
      list of all ingredient names whose quantity is below threshold
